metadata.title: CVE-2020-27840 on Ubuntu 18.04 FIPS Certified (bionic) - high
metadata.description:
A flaw was found in samba. Spaces used in a string around a domain name(DN), while supposed to be ignored, can cause invalid DN strings withspaces to instead write a zero-byte into out-of-bounds memory, resulting ina crash. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to systemavailability.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2020-27840` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

ldb-tools - 2:1.2.3-1ubuntu0.2
libldb1 - 2:1.2.3-1ubuntu0.2
python-ldb - 2:1.2.3-1ubuntu0.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: ldb package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2:1.2.3-1ubuntu0.2').
